metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2818 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in MozillaFirefox before 47.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.2 allow remote attackersto cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) orpossibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2818` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
